intro: Laportea evitata, commonly known as the Mexican velvetleaf, is a herbaceous plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has heart-shaped, velvety leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators. Laportea evitata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both wet and dry conditions.
